website_summaries.verdict: A convenient, easy-to-use "superwatch" with many valuable features. The best on the market.
pros: Off the charts in terms of capabilities and functions
Does not require a chest strap
cons: Expensive, but its features and performance are worth the cost

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a running watch!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Surge because I wanted to consolidate devices, as I had been wearing both a Charge HR and Garmin on my runs. After withholding judgement for a month, I am now officially unimpressed with the Surge, primarily because the GPS is unreliable. On most runs, the GPS either tracks erratically or just stops altogether. Also, on the increasingly rare occasion that the GPS tracks throughout the run, FitBit doesn't sync workouts to MapMyRun (despite advertising otherwise), so I have to manually download/upload a .tcx file to MMR. Finally, no auto-pause, cadence, and elevation charts make the Surge fail even the most basic tests for a running watch. I'm switching back to Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Douglas

customer_reviews.title: My dog chewed through the watch strap. So, ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed through the watch strap. So, I'm willing to pay to replace the strap, which is a common service for any watch. The Fitbit support people told me they don't sell only the watch strap. I also believe this is because of the watch's ineffective design that does not allow the strap to be replaced. How ridiculous! Just because of a watch strap, the $273.70 watch becomes a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Known defect with wristband
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch, but every three months or so, the rubber exterior on the band starts bubbling and detaching. According to the Internets, it's a common problem that has to do with humidity, but this is happening no matter how much I take care of it. I'm on my third replacement now. $250 is too much to pay for having to get the watch replaced every three months. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, prone to breaking
customer_reviews.text: I use to think this was a nice product, but DONT GET IT, ive had one for 15 months and its broken twice. First time in the first six months, the band snapped off. The second time 9 months after that, the same issue with the band breaking off. However now they wont replace the product and only offer you 25% off your next purchase so you can buy another item that will just break. Please dont get this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Cho

customer_reviews.title: "You had one job"
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this watch for a few reasons: but at the core, the required amount of synchronization it requires (I am on the road frequently and don't have the time or the patience to synchronize it up to a computer as often as they suggest to keep the software up to date) is simply not feasible for me. It then becomes very frustrating (if you're not able to sync regularly) when your smartwatch "with one job" fails even at the simplest of tasks. I found myself cursing technology and opting for a simpler watch that has no software or updates...just tells time and has a stopwatch. Fitbit has a great reputation but I was quite disappointed with this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B. Landau

customer_reviews.title: to get the 4 functions shown in the sales photo on thewatch face at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for the Heart Rate function....like so many others, that function fails....it is worthless to me, a heart rate patient on coumadin wondering what his HR is....worthless device...and look at the response below when I asked about getting it set up....no call...just a terse: to get the 4 functions shown in the sales photo on thewatch face at the same time oh, so thank you for the help!
customer_reviews.author: William Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars, Horrible Product made by a disgustingly un professional Company.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked for 2 months, then it went bat s*** crazy with Heart rates and other things. According to device I walked over 1000 steps during my sleep. Waste of money and now that its broke Fitbit and their affiliated warranty company Squaretrade wont give me back my money. Fit-Bit even said issue would happen again since its a software issue. Why would I take a refurbish or replacement for the same issue that they said they can't figure out how to fix. Federal Law states regardless of Company policy. The consumer has a right to a Replacement, Refurbished or"REFUND". I love how these awefull companies ast as though thats not an option.
customer_reviews.author: RBN978

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Surge in Two Years is not a good sign
customer_reviews.text: I am now on my 3rd Fit Bit Surge watch. This one is also becoming delaminated, just like the other two, again where the band meets the watch. To date, Fit Bit and Amazon have been very good about replacing it, and I have no doubt they may make the same offer, however, three watches, three times it has come apart at the same point, where the band meets the watch face. Seems like they would make an improvement to this watch or discontinue it altogether. Other than this not so minor issue, it is a great watch, great functionality, does everything I want it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T Teenor

customer_reviews.title: The strap breaks in between 6 months and 2 years .
customer_reviews.text: The strap breaks between 6 months and 2 years rendering the watch unusable and unrepairable by them. I didn't wear mine that much and bought it 1 1/2 years ago. Fitbit will replace them if LT 12 months from purchase date. They will offer you a 25% discount on a replacement if over 12 months. I did find a you tube video where you can fix it your self. Search Surge watch band repair on Youtube and a general search for the band. Cost LT $20 My next watch will be an Apple. Those straps are replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member JW

customer_reviews.title: Wrist Band Problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch 27 months ago. It's ok but the wrist band breaks down. Fitbit replaced the watch a few months after I reported that the band was breaking down where the hasp enters the band. This problem reoccurred recently and I had to buy a replacement band from a third party. My trainer also bought a surge and he's also having problems with the wrist band breaking down. I wouldn't buy another Surge because of the wrist band issues. If I were going to buy another Fitbit watch, I'd consider the Blaze model (it's cheaper too).
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Band tears
customer_reviews.text: The band will rip after extended use. Replaced once, and now twice, had the extra warrenty thank god, getting refund, the band ripped again. I don't recommend unless you actually buy an extra warranty. 7/8/16 - I added 2 stars because these devices do perform well. I am hoping they fix the band tearing issue with a revision.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap watch good customer service
customer_reviews.text: My surge worked fine for about 11 months then the screen became unreadable. I contacted Fitbit customer service and tried the fix they recommended. After several attempts it became clear that this wasn't going to work. After calling them again they sent me a new device. Their customer service was outstanding in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: I liked the first one and this one was better
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Surge watch. I liked the first one and this one was better. For some unknown reason it suddenly started to accumulate condensation on the inside of the the crystal. I went to Amazon and described the problem. My issue was handled immediately and this watch was returned for full credit. Once again, this was a better unit than the one it replaced from a feature standpoint. The failure was in the construction of the device not the technical performance. Rather than ordering a direct replacement I instead upped my cost and ordered a FitBit Iconic. when it arrives I will look forward to what FitBIt says is a significant upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Hocking

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty accurate tracker as far as I could tell, but then again who knows how many calories you really burn other than going to a doctor/nutritionist. It's a fitness tracker, so you get what you put into it. If you're active and like to see all those stats while working out ( I know I do), then you should get it. It's a little pricey and I wish it was cheaper, but there's not a lot of "good" fitness trackers out there. I've used the older models of Fitbits as well and this one is definitely big upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Total ripoff!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my long wearing Fitbit with something more sophisticated and state-of-the-art so I ordered the Fitbut Surge Superwatch. After several days of trying to see the very dark, almost unreadable, screen I decided to try to "sync" it. I followed the accompanying instructions, went online for guidance and even called Fibit tech support and it still would not "synch"...I returned the watch along with an extra cable by registered mail last December, I received a $7. credit for the cable but, in spite of the fact both were packaged together, I'm still waiting for my almost $250 refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thoman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a birthday present for the end of January and went with a name brand. First the band bubbled and was coming apart in less than two months they sent a replacement then in July the screen cracked and it's keeping track but can no longer read the screen. I have sent two messages to find out if anything can be done as they had already had to replace it once,but I have not had a response .It's not an inexpensive item and am very disappointed in the durability. Seems it should hold up for more than half a year .
customer_reviews.author: Debbie A Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the FALSE ADVERTISEMENT of the choice of features ...
customer_reviews.text: One broke at the connection of the band to the face. However Fitbit replaced it. Disappointed in the FALSE ADVERTISEMENT of the choice of features on the face. There is NO option to show the pulse rate at all times on the face. This is the only reason I purchased them, two of them, and paid a small fortune for them. Totally could have gone with the cheaper ones. Bringing this point up to FitBit was redundant. Dishonest advertising, but decent product for the features it does have. Waiting on our Pebble 2s anyway, which will replace these as soon as they arrive. Will add our Surges to the rest of our FitBits in the junk drawer unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Tokyo Tammy Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Look at other fitness watches
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself is great but beware of the wristband. It appears the band cracks and separates from the watch rendering the watch absolutely useless. It's a known problem with the Surge (obviously by all the web postings) and Fitbit continues to sell it with the defect. Fitbit offers a 25% discount towards a new purchase but it still doesn't solve the problem of a defective wristband. I would stay away from the Surge and look at other fitness watches until Fitbit addresses the problem..
customer_reviews.author: blue lobsta

customer_reviews.title: I love it, I wear it everyday
customer_reviews.text: Got dicipline? Want it? This can help you in ways you never expected. I love it, I wear it everyday. This is definately helping me. I am a self-starter who lately has been losing her mojo. Family stress, getting older, etc. I used to be a fitness nut, but not so much in the last few years. This is a game changer. No one around to nag you? Heh. This has it covered. My ONLY gripe? When I turn it off, I want it to STAY off. When charging it has to be on, apparantly. It turns on at the drop of a hat otherwise and when I am not wearing it I don't want to drain the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous that it would start breaking down so easily and quickly
customer_reviews.text: Despite not wearing every day, the band has worn and peeled off so quickly! I've been pregnant and not working out every since getting it...what would happen when I actually wear it regularly and while working out! Ridiculous that it would start breaking down so easily and quickly, being as expensive as it is. Has never given notifications from my phone. So disappointed to open that much on it and have it be so poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: chad van kley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Just got it and love it. I will "update" in 90 days to discuss any issues that arise. Just want folks to know that I can barely work my remote control but this is so easy, pretty much sets itself up. I ordered a Large because when I measured my wrist it said 6'7 but there is a lot of room left over. One thing I will let folks know is that when you first put on the device, those "Calories Burned" you see that are already in there are the Fitbit estimating what you body burned since midnight the night before, so don't panic (like I did). Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Roz Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Not good in several important ways
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit does a really bad job of measuring heart rate during exercise, often incorrect by as much as 50% from actual. It seems to be OK on counting steps and also for heart rate during rest. The impact is that it wildly underestimates the intensity of the exercise and the corresponding calorie burn with the result that the rest of the dash board computations are also wrong.Their official response to this situation is that they only measure "average heart rate over five minute periods" so it may be ok for steady state running but is not ok for intermittent exercise such as strength training, interval training or similar.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Wears down quickly. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband less than 6 months ago. Unfortunately, before even six months were up, the material of the watchband started coming apart. And like some other pictures in reviews, the inside of the band completely came apart. My husband is in the military but had to take it off to recharge nearly everyday. So I would say that the battery life deteriorated rather quickly. You would think for a sports watch that was “built” to track all these things, it would be made a little tougher. A couple of weeks ago as well, the battery stopped charging completely. There’s no way to replace the band as well. He was pretty unsatisified with this product.
customer_reviews.author: kaylee hudson

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive for something that will likely not last you a year.
customer_reviews.text: First one (black band) lasted nearly a year before the band started cracking around screws. Went through the painless warranty process and received new one. Second one (blue band) lasted 5.5 months before the band started to bubble and fall apart. Warranty only lasts for 1 year from first purchase, does not restart with replacement. After googling both issues, seems they are both very common and known issues that Fitbit is aware of but not fixing. Never had any issues with the electronic part of the watch, just the bands, but they are all one part and not replaceable. Way too expensive for something that will likely not last you a year.
customer_reviews.author: jen k

customer_reviews.title: Worse yet is the fact that it's not very native ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is an absolute disaster. Beyond the band that is as irritates skin, there's the much larger issue of user interface. It is impossibly confusing. Worse yet is the fact that it's not very native to the running experience.Info about strides are fine, but what about basics such as, "How long did it take me to run that previous mile?" There are also many messaging apps on phones -- basic well used ones -- that the Surge doesn't work well with. Also, it's very difficult to read the messages that do manage to come through. A complete waste, and even though it's been five months since I bought it, I'm still returning it Amazon. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Good Fitness Tracker / Durability of Band Questionable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I have used my Fitbit Surge for about 2 years. In that time I have used it to track exercise with GPS which posts nicely into Strava once you allow the integration on the Fitbit website. Counts steps and heart rate fairly accurately. The battery life is fine. Cons: The band is cracked around the four screws that secure it. Disappointing. Simple reinforcement and a replaceable band would fix the issue. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: I. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The durability is not too great -- especially for a fitness watch. I have gone through two in 1.5 years. The first one's band broke within 3 months and they replaced it for free; however, the second one has now done the same and they won't replace as out of warranty. The heart rate monitor does not appear too accurate and it also does not accurately track steps from elliptical even when on elliptical setting. At times, it also would decide to not count steps.
customer_reviews.author: B S 100

customer_reviews.title: Walking More and Eating Better
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Fitbit! The sleep function really gave me insight into why I was tired on some days. I find myself parking further from my destination since I can really see the benefits of adding those few to several extra steps to your day. So far, I am down 3 lbs with 27 to go in 2.5 weeks, but it has simply made my weight loss easier and me more aware of what goes into a healthier me. My only suggestion would be for Fitbit to add many more items to their food lists, as the food log can be time consuming at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: sdwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Badly designed charging port!
customer_reviews.text: This accurately measures heart rate. It does its job in keeping records of workouts. I matched it with my cardiologist's EKG machine during a stress echo test and the heart rate readings were right on. HOWEVER---the charging cable is a disaster. It is very difficult to keep in the device and the slightest jar will cause it to fall out. THE COMPANY NEEDS TO RE-DESIGN THE CHARGING PORT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G. Shibley

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the Surge - DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 different fitbit decices, and over the past five years they have been great! Think twice about the Surge - hard to set up, notifications & music control never worked, the face diodes are NO where as luminous as the photos show! My Surge unsynched from my phones, hours on the phone with fitbit were fruitless! (I've gone back to my one)! Amazon was great about the return! Your better off with a Blaze or Charge!
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Heiman

customer_reviews.title: Dead after less than two years' use
customer_reviews.text: Before it died, I was unhappy because it was uncomfortable to wear and did not give accurate heart rate readings as compared to clinical heart monitors attached simultaneously with Fitbit, but it cost $250; so, I kept using it. This morning after about 21 months of use, it just quit syncing with my app. Customer Support couldn't bring it back to life; so, they offered me discounts to purchase a new fitbit. When, however, the rep noticed that the Surge had disappeared from my account, after I removed it at her instruction, she said the discounts would no longer be available unless I mailed the old fitbit to them. My advice, say your money. Avoid fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: xVicar

customer_reviews.title: I gave it an "F"
customer_reviews.text: Really bought this to monitor my heart rate during interval training. I gave it an "F" in that department. My 50 dollar polar heart rate monitor does a much better job. At 55 years old I believe it is essential to accurately track your heart rate during training, especially if you train intensely, which I do. The Surge has not been able to track my heart rate consistently at all during intervals. For the most part it won't budge past about 142 bpm, and I know that I'm at least at 160 bpm. Going back to my old reliable polar. Glad I kept it. Gave the Surge about a month trial and unfortunately it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Problems with band
customer_reviews.text: Problems with band. The band started cracking, started small and finally broke. Company sent a replacement under warranty. The replacement band started peeling. Called company, now warranty expired. The only offer is 25% off any purchased product I told the company I will switch to a different company
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, both software and hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap band, broke with normal use after less than six months. Screen cracked too, from who lnows what. I never dropped it. Actually I babied it more than any electronic item ive ever owned. Remarkably cheap construction for a $250 dollar watch. Just replaced it with Microsoft band 2 and coukdnt be happier. Last fitbit product I will ever buy. If that was all it would be enough to sink the product but for whatever reason on a weekly basis it would stop communicating with my iPhone and wouldnt keep track of my steps. Just overall poor design and function.
customer_reviews.author: A fan of books

customer_reviews.title: Don't sweat while wearing this
customer_reviews.text: I work at a restaurant and get a little sweaty so I think why not buy a fitness band that is designed to get a little sweaty and keep on going well boy did I make the wrong choice after two weeks it had moisture under the screen and two days after that it conked out. if you ever plan on actually using this for what it is designed then expect it to last a whole three weeks before it dies on you this is not worth your time or money don't get it
customer_reviews.author: mag

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Still use although now outdated. Not very feminine. Band needs to be sturdier and not stretch out of shape. A little difficult for a non-tech person to get the full benefits of the watch. Large font & auto light make it easy to read even in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's better to get the HR 2
customer_reviews.text: Bands can't be interchangeable, mine ripped n Fitbit said to talk to the seller. So I did n Amazon issued a refund. Thank you amazon for always having my back. I did have extended warranty on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: I have an Alta which I love and was looking to upgrade. My husband has a Surge, which he loves, My experience with the Surge has been very different than his. The Surge was difficult to set up but the worst part is it only tracks exercise of any kind intermittently and, since the whole reason I wear a tracker is to track my exercise, I am back to wearing my Alta. It works great for me. In addition, I developed a rash on my arm from just wearing the Surge during the day. It is also very bulky on a small wrist like mine. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Dana LV

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit has replaced both thewatch and charging paraphernelia twice and spent hours on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a 2016 Christmas gift for my boyfriend as he does a lot of hiking. Little did I know I was just buying hours and hours of frustration. From the beginning, it has not charged correctly. Fitbit has replaced both the watch and charging paraphernelia twice and spent hours on the phone and online chat trying to get the problem corrected to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS OR TRUST THAT THEY STAND BEHIND THEIR PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: This watch is defective. Design flaw the band separates from the watch and the company changed the design and renamed it. They won’t stand behind the reality that it had a design flaw and ask you to spend $179 to replace it! Two years of wearing and it fell apart- that’s not designed to last as they advertise. The fit bit Blaze bought at the same time is fine - different design. Obviously they knew there was a problem and yet they think I should spend another $179 to replace it? Bad costumer service! Not standing behind their products. Not fixing a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves his Fitbit but I am not so ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his Fitbit but I am not so thrilled . He is on his 3rd watch :( I have to say the company has been most responsive to the problems with this watch but , none the less I would have expected it to be more durable, and less troublesome. The first watch signaled an update needed with a light but there was no update and the light would not go away. The company replaced the watch. The band on the replacement watch has separated at the watch face. The company replaced it as well. So we are on watch #3 and I am hoping it will last longer than the last two.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D Stein

customer_reviews.title: Love the touch screen
customer_reviews.text: I initially started out with the flex to see if I'd like wearing something on my wrist and it quickly gave out, so I upgraded to the surge. I like the display and the many options. I can swipe the screen to see my steps and floors and read my text messages. After a few months I started to notice it was irritating my wrist so I took it off for a bit. The only problem I have is that it does not record steps when pushing strollers, wheelchairs or stretchers. You can set it track a workout when walking with a stroller but I don't feel as if you get the same number of steps.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J.

customer_reviews.title: I've had the product for about five days. Battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product for about five days. Battery life not what stated fully charged yesterday afternoon today at noon the battery is only at half-life. Second issue fitbit coinciding application for iPhone does not work properly. Barcode scanning of food entry five days later still not in the system. Two issues really make the product undesirable.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: would be great, if it would last
customer_reviews.text: its really great - for first few months. After three months the band is bubling around the face of the watch and the battery time is down to barely two days rather then advertised 5+. Support people are very friendly and helpful, but being on my third Surge, I see that it happens every time, its just an issue when. One lasted almost a year, other two just 3-4 months. If you are fine with spending $200+ for a gadget that would be useless after few months, go ahead. Otherwise be ready for a long sessions with (very friendly) support staff and frequent replacements
customer_reviews.author: Adam G.

customer_reviews.title: Best of a bad bunch, bit still flawed
customer_reviews.text: Got this end of January and liked it until now (June) where it has stopped working properly. The watch only offers one type of workout option to choose from, which is Open Run. Before this happened, I was generally satisfied. The Good: - Sleep tracking is useful - GPS is accurate - App is decent - Call alerts are useful considering I don't hear my phone most of the time - Step count is accurate - Biking and gym workouts measured accurately The Bad: - I get a really bad rash if I wear the watch for a few days straight (which it is supposedly designed for) - Watch stopped working properly after 5 months (per above)
customer_reviews.author: Noel Reidy

customer_reviews.title: I can not say enough about how much I love my Fitbit Surge
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough about how much I love my Fitbit Surge. I have had it about a month now and it has motivated every single day to get out there and walk at least 10,000 steps. It helps me calculate how much food I can have for the day based on how much exercise I have gotten. It monitors sleep, heart rate, calories burned and more. I find myself looking at it constantly during the day to keep track of where I need to be. I LOVE IT!! Highly recommend this to anyone who is trying to live a healthy lifestyle and or to lose weight. A+++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Teagirl49

customer_reviews.title: Loved the tracker and what it does but I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: First one lasted two weeks and quite counting steps. It was replaced at no charge to me the second lasted 9 days and the screen went black. this time I ask for a refund. Loved the tracker and what it does but I can't get one to last
customer_reviews.author: Juli

customer_reviews.title: Forget the Surge....Go Ionic
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit did not function as expected when I received it. I could not get it to sync and the watch face/time did not display. After two days of trying to get it functioning (I even enlisted the help of someone that has Fitbit experience and she couldn't get it to work) I returned it. With that said, I did spend a little more and purchase an Ionic which I absolutely love so I'm glad the Surge didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Gahagen

customer_reviews.title: Substandard product and costly
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for almost a year now. I bought it for supposedly good battery life. Battery only lasts 3-4 days and I do not use notifications or constant Bluetooth on this. I also believe this is not too accurate. Calories wise it reports more calories spent than actual spent. I use this for running as wel as other iPhone based fitness trackers and calories spent are constantly 20-25 percent higher on this than other fitness trackers. High cost does not make it better either. My advise is to stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Trader

customer_reviews.title: so very disappointing for such a cool device. Poor quality. Planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: with your first order you will get a one piece injection molded rubber device with no replaceable parts. In about six months it falls apart and you get a free replacement sent to you. When that replacement device fails you're out of luck. BUy a different device. The Fitbit surge has no replaceable Parts it is designed to fail. With approximately a six-month lifespan. See my pictures for rubber to plastic separation of The Wristband. No Solutions. None. Very disappointing. Extremely disappointing for such a really cool device I can't upload pictures just imagine the rubber separating completely from the plastic wristband
customer_reviews.author: electric mower guy

customer_reviews.title: Should of bought Apple!
customer_reviews.text: I love this except that if the battery goes bad you can’t replace it, you will have to remove the straps that basically ruins the watch as they are not replaceable. I will never buy a Fitbit again. Customer service at fitbit were not helpful either. They offered me a 90% discount on a new one but never got anything via email. Not Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Tse

customer_reviews.title: I love the app
customer_reviews.text: I love the app. The band is confortable. Customer service was amazing... but there is something wrong with this band. Is is not water resistant I had 3 broken that way because of heavy rain. Another one I broke the screen I don't know how and I another one the internal screen chip in a million parts... Still works at least
customer_reviews.author: Oscar F.

customer_reviews.title: ... for almost 2 years and it has been a good fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this watch for almost 2 years and it has been a good fitness tracker, gps works good, I enjoy that about it. The bad part is the integrated band. I have had it replaced 2x for the band coming apart. I have had this third one for about 6 months and the band is peeling off the watch by the face. The amount of money I spent on this watch the band should not be so cheap I will purchase a different watch when this finally breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Burke

customer_reviews.title: I love my fitbit surge
customer_reviews.text: I love my fitbit surge. I like the tangerine color. It was easy to set up with my I phone 6. I would recommend ordering the screen protectors for it. After 3 days of wearing it the screen protector cracked. I was worried because I thought I broke the whole screen but it was fine. So you might want to buy extra screen protectors for it. After this happened I also bought these pretty sleeve protects for it to protect it even more because I clean for a living.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lost customer due to crap quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Sept. 2015, this month it finally started acting up. Past year warranty through Fitbit - it is what it is. I actively wore the watch everyday, even when it did cause a mild rash. Soap and water seemed to help reduce rash after activities that left sweat on the back of watch. I thought for 200 plus this watch would last much longer. I would not recommend this product, though YMMV. I will probably not buy a Fitbit product again TBH. I've had the original dongle and clip then this, every product has had some complication or another. Just my 0.02...
customer_reviews.author: John Serna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.  Returning.
customer_reviews.text: Returning it. Backlight is very dim, even on best setting. I know it's that way intentionally...to save battery life...but what's the use of battery life if you can't read the display?? Also, Surge apparently still has problems with text notifications/music control on Android phones. Before buying, you might want to go to "Community" at fitbit and read some of the reviews there. A number of folks have said they're returning the Surge for the dim backlight. I also have a Charge, which is very bright and easy to read. I had hoped to get use the Surge's GPS function on hikes, but guess I'll stick to Map My Hike....
customer_reviews.author: Janice McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Good for steps, not so good for sleep, and don't forget to charge it up
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying the Fitbit in my quest to make sure I get in enough steps everyday. I found trying to track steps using the phone alone was unreliable because sometimes I forgot to carry it with me. I had hoped to use this watch to track my sleep as well, but found that wearing the watch while I was sleeping usually had me waking up with numbness and tingling in my hand. I also had to get used to charging the phone every three days -- the pulse sensor takes a lot of power.
customer_reviews.author: Taparaho

customer_reviews.title: Stopped syncing after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped syncing after 3 months. I also have a Fitbit Charge 2 that I purchased in October 2017 -- it still works great. My Surge worked well when it was syncing with the app and then it just stopped. I reached out to Fitbit for support help and they couldn't help me get the device synced to my account/phone app. They gave me a replacement and I couldn't get that to work either. Anybody want to a free Fitbit Surge? Ugh
customer_reviews.author: J. VanDusen

customer_reviews.title: Folow instructions to avoid the infamous rash.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Most of the bad reviews I've seen are from people getting a rash from the band. I got the rash two weeks after I bought the Surge. Understandably, I got it after FOUR DAYS of not removing the Surge from my wrist for a second except for showering. I followed Fitbit's instructions for proper wear/use, and the rash disappeared. This is not dissimilar to rashes you might get from extended wear of a regular watch. Also, this is not meant to be a smart watch. Its primary function is fitness tracking, so if that's what you're after, this is appropriate for nearly every scenario.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A.

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Surge Faulty Wristband Comes Apart During Normal Use
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit electonics are awesome, but this Surge device literally comes apart at the seams during normal use. The attached image shows my husband's second Surge to rip apart during normal use in less than a year and a half. I recommend staying away from any Fitbit devices with similar bands. One instance can be chalked up to bad luck. Two instances in less than a year points to serious red flags in design and manufacturing. It's a shame to have to use a strong rubber band to hold this Surge together.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Flynn Thorsen

customer_reviews.title: ... a Surge for a birthday present and it worked fine for about a month
customer_reviews.text: Received a Surge for a birthday present and it worked fine for about a month, but then the battery no longer held a charge. I would charge it overnight and had a full battery in the morning, but the battery would only hold the charge for the day, needing a recharge. The wrist band is not easy to attach to your wrist. The texture is too rough. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Save your money get an apple watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is over $250 and the screen works like the first model of a computer. It's bulky and cannot lay flat and the band is made of rubber. You cannot purchase a new band, so once the rubber separates from the watch you will need a new one. I cannot find the logic in purchasing a watch with a rubber made band that cannot be replaced when it rips. Lastly, they introduced the Fitbit Blaze, which has a sleek modern design, better screen, and guess what its only $199. The screen of the new watch is comparable to the apple watch, so I'm asking myself why did I buy this over priced piece of junk?
customer_reviews.author: OhWow

customer_reviews.title: OK product, connectivity issues, not great support
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product for two and a half years. I has not been able to sync it for about eight months. Which means you can't set the time. That's seems outrageously short sighted,. Music controls don't allow the phone to connect to a speaker via Bluetooth, so it has limited use. Wired earbuds would work. I have owned a Garmin (vivosmart) that allowed this type of connection. I believe the syncing issues happen when operating systems get updated. Apple and Android. Online support is responsive but not able to solve any issues, and I believe they are deceptive. Glued on wrist bands that don't last. I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: ScoobeE

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I bought it with the hopes of tracking my heart rate (to get accurate caloric burn), this thing is WAY off. I compared the watches reading with my Polar telemetry strap-the difference was 30+ bpm. I should have just gotten the iWatch like I intended.
customer_reviews.author: wyobell

customer_reviews.title: Product has a fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.text: A product that would easily get at least for stars from me if they were to fix the band of the watch. It is heavy rubber that rubs against the wrist and causes rub burns and marks so bad I had to stop using the product. I initially wore gauze underneath so the rubber did not make contact with my skin. This worked fine, but looked ridiculous. Two months after I stopped wearing it I still have noticeable red marks where the skin came in contact with the band of the watch. It's a shame because, otherwise, it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! JUNK! AND THEY DON'T BACK THEIR PRODUCT AFTER THE TWELVE MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy! This is the 3rd fitbit I purchased and all 3 have fallen apart. This is the latest purchase and because we've owned it for 14 months, they won't replace the band that has fallen apart. For the money you spend on these, you would think they would back their product. All they would offer is 25% off of our next purchase. Fitbit, There won't be a next time! FOLLOW UP: Because we expressed our dissatisfaction of their support, they said they will provide a one time replacement or a 30% discount on an upgrade. I stand by my review... I'm still not satisfied they willingly stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure.
customer_reviews.text: So far ok. Syncing took forever. Finally registering. Floors, steps and calories are registering, HRM is not, no matter what I do, and have tried every troubleshooting problem. Already contacting Fitbit support with the issue. Not happy with the order right now as this is why I got a HRM so I could monitor my heart rate, but isn't working. Have reset it multiple times, playing with the on and auto HR sensor, moved the band around higher lower on wrist, still nothing. I will update my review if this changes or gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Randiidawnn

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as a Christmas present. Initially this was an awesome gift. Within a year the band started breaking apart. When I got a hold of Fitbit I was right outside my 1year warranty. This is a known problem and they said they would give me a credit to buy another one. I said no you need to replace this one it is a manufacturer's defect. They did but now the replacement which I have no doubt is a refurb has already died with a few months. Will not buy another Fitbit fitness product again!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Buckle broke in less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I am returning my Surge in the morning. I loved my FitBit Flex. When I heard about the Surge I thought hard before buying it. It is so expensive, but the features really attracted me. Why am I returning it? Because the band is flimsy. After less than two weeks of wearing it, the buckle broke and the Surge fell off my wrist--all while I was asleep! Very disappointed in flimsy construction. Going back to my flex if I can find it.
customer_reviews.author: S A McLean

customer_reviews.title: you can do much better. Not happy at all with the product
customer_reviews.text: The product description claims that the watch is water proof but it really is not. From the start, I started to get that condensation on the inside of the glass and it comes and goes. Now the rubber on the band is starting to bubble and separate from the band itself. See the attached photo. I am trying to see about returning it and I cant even see on my order where it came from or how to return it. For the money, you can do much better. Not happy at all with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Harris

customer_reviews.title: Can't replace poorly made watch band
customer_reviews.text: LONG TERM REVIEW ' The company could provide you with bands that attach with screws but refuse to do so. I loved my Surge but not with broken product from cracking rubber at 14 months. Now the Surge is not usable with broken band. Great while it worked
customer_reviews.author: Harry L. Of Treyburn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I each purchased these watches around Christmas 2016. They do not track our activities at all or totally off the mark. We walk side-by-side for 3 miles. His registers less than 3 miles and mine just over 2 miles. We have both reset them multiple times but they are not tracking with accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Surge seems to work fine, but I find it cumbersome to wear
customer_reviews.text: My Surge seems to work fine, but I find it cumbersome to wear. By that I mean it is pretty thick especially at the top end as you look at the watch face, so it catches on long sleeve clothing. I also agree with other comments and would like to see other watch face options, for example a larger time display option. It seems like this shouldn't be a big deal and should be just a software update. On the positive side I have checked the GPS distance measurement and find it within 3% of what the Runkeeper app on my iPhone yields; obviously I don't know which is "right" but to me it doesn't matter, 3% is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent tracker, poor design
customer_reviews.text: Beware any who purchase this fitness tracker. While the Surge does what I purchased it for, I am very disappointed with the quality of the device - specifically, they band. The band is molded to the body of the tracker, but whatever material they used becomes brittle over a short period of time and begins to deteriorate. (Forewarned: the band is not replaceable.) You have a 1-year replacement warranty. And while most us see that remediation are satisfied, they just get another Surge with the same issue. The pictures are after just 7 mos.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gardner

customer_reviews.text: Love love love this. Super great for someone trying to get into working out, losing weight or gaining it. It keeps you motivated by reminding you to get your steps in. And being able to see how many steps, stairs and calories you’ve burned is motivating in itself! I got a new phone however and it was extremely difficult setting up on my new phone not sure why
customer_reviews.author: Brianna C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it wet!!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't buy mine on Amazon, but I did like it very much....until I dropped it in 3 feet of water while wading in a fresh water lake.....I grabbed it out of the water within seconds, but the watch went completely kaput....trashed.....worthless.....nothing worked and the screen clouded over and stayed that way. I can't imagine a watch that isn't at least a little bit water resistant.....but I was warned...so it's my bad...
customer_reviews.author: Juan Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to stay on track with fitness goals
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift. I have the charge 2 in small. Wonderful device! Shows text messages, heart rate monitor, GPS, tracks sleep, motivates you to get up and move, has settings for Spin, Yoga, Outdoor Running, Treadmill Running, etc. You can even switch out the bands. Very expensive, but worth the money if you are serious about monitoring health and staying fit.
customer_reviews.author: karin

customer_reviews.title: ultimately decided I didn't need a fitbit and have been happy without one
customer_reviews.text: the portion of the fitbit the band mounts onto crumbled and a band couldn't be replaced. was provided a replacement fitbit that wouldn't hold a charge. ultimately decided I didn't need a fitbit and have been happy without one. my research shows this model has been plagued with similar problems with design. and I did use the cetaphil cleaner on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Surge
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that I couldn't have two fitbits on my IPhone. My husband has an old flip top phone and it will not sync to that phone. I have also tried to sync with my computer and also my IPad with no success. He is mostly concerned with his heart rate so does have access to that information, I would really like to be able to access the charts that are available.online and will try to find someone that can help me access what we need.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: + Fitbit web interface is great + Easy syncing with app - Poor quality band - Very big on my wrist, as a 5' 11" 230lb man - Battery life is very poor. I struggled to make it past 24 hours
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: $250 of junk
customer_reviews.text: So, I have done p90x for years now. So I have an idea of what my heart rate should be. So I read the instructions, put it on, set it to "excercise" and to my surprise it worked fine when I was laying down doing ab exercises but if I'm up and doing something where I should have a hr around 140-160 it shows 82-99. This is junk! Update... Had it for 55 days now and this thing is horrible. I hate it and I wish I could send it back. If anyone knows how after the 30 days let me know!
customer_reviews.author: K. Turney

customer_reviews.title: Defectively built
customer_reviews.text: This watch has a defect, the way the band attaches to the watch tears and cannot be replaced, the first watch was replaced within the first year, the repacement did the same thing within a year, because the warranty on the original order had expired, Fitbit would not replace the second one, we tried to argue the case of the defect, our emails were ignored... bad service!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: This company is a pile of trash
customer_reviews.text: i keep trying with this company. they keep sending me faulty products. THEY DONT TURN ON, THEY DONT CHARGE, THEY DONT CONNECT, THEY DONT TRACK. ive tried so many of them and they all suck. i dont know why i keep trying over and over again, i want to lose weight and have a healthy life but my gosh. ive had like 5 of them only small amount of time for each of them. i do not recommend this product or brand.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tovatt

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Surge - waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: A $250 dollar watch should last more then a year before the battery quits or at least have replaceable battery. The fitbit has neither. My Surge died, battery would not hold charge more than a few minutes. Fitbit informed me that it was over a year old, by a month, and there are no replacement battery options. Customer service is really poor. To top it all off, the app is terrible. I'm looking at other brands for future tracker needs
customer_reviews.author: Gary Beckner

customer_reviews.title: We were greatly disappointed as it was a gift given to a family ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Surge Fitbit for a Christmas gift, on Christmas morn tried all day to sync it, finally call Fitbit Rep, he worked with us trying to get it to sync with no success, he said the Fitbit was defective. We were greatly disappointed as it was a gift given to a family member for their Christmas gift. And I was embarrassed, I had to explain that it was “new” according to display for order on Amazon, not refurbished. Fitbit was very understanding and a new one is on the way.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Holley

customer_reviews.title: this watch was pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.text: this watch was pretty amazing.......until.....the update. Then it all went to down. I couldn't link with my computer. I couldn't link to my phone( Note 4, a phone on the designated list) and the USB linking hub would find it but the watch failed to link. Now I do work in the extremes of hot and cold so in all fairness I'm rough on equipment. However, I bought this because of the " sturdiness" mentioned in the reviews. this thing it a terrible waste of money. Fitbit, Get your act together. I'm switching to garmin I think.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lamothe

customer_reviews.title: Not what It should be.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice watch, a lot of features, but I needed accurate sleep tracking, sometimes I'll be wide awake in my bed, and it record that I'm sleeping, sometimes I'll fall asleep on the couch for 20-30 minutes, but the Surge don't think so. Stairs climbing, driving back from work 85 mile trip will show that I climbed 2 stairs (is this a joke? I'm driving at 75 mph) is it a stupid GPS. Still not convinced that a $250 watch is not suitable for swimming (it's a fit watch AHHHHHH)
customer_reviews.author: ChadiHK

customer_reviews.title: It's okay not a great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and although I'm sure the step count isn't completely accurate, it gives you a goal to reach everyday. It's a bit bulky for a woman but I had to have the best one! My main complaint is the battery life that doesn't last 7 days as stated, it rarely lasts me 3 full days. It sucks when it dies and I don't have the charger with me, I do enjoy looking at my stats every 2 minutes of my life lol
customer_reviews.author: christina rose

customer_reviews.title: NOT water proof!!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is awesome. I wanted a fitness tracker, but not a smart watch. The idea of an apple watch was attractive, but I also wanted the ability to detach from technology and the outside world. This shows me text messages (when I want to see them), counts my steps/activity, and my heart rate. The only draw backs is that it is a little bulky and is NOT WATER PROOF. Other than that, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: rsh09

customer_reviews.title: Really like the fitbit.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Wife started with her fitbit and encouraged me to step up and lose some weight, so I did. Watch works very well. I like the blue tooth connect to my iphone and the fancy fitbit weighing scales. I also like the gps tracker so I can really see how far I hiked, calories burned, heart rate, all that good stuff. Doctor really liked getting stats on me from the monthly reports available. This and matching exercise & diet, I've dropped about 20 lbs and still going. If I don't run the gps it will go 2 days between charges. All in all, very well worth the purchase cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good well featured watch. Not bling. Good feature set
customer_reviews.text: Solid easy to use and helpful. Heart rate is accurate and the steps, stairs and altimeter with GPS is quite on the mark. Just remember to charge it when you take a shower ( take it off!) at least every other day. Not fancy nor full of geek appeal, just good to have. Captures phone calls and text messages from my Nexus 6 (gotta wear the watch and have the 6 near by🤗
customer_reviews.author: Nadoka

customer_reviews.title: Quickly fell apart. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Wrist band "bubbled" and came apart. Text display stopped working. Phone call display worked well at first, but now always displays "unknown caller", rendering it practically useless. When I contacted Fit bit for support, they ran the serial number of my Surge and refused to help. It is too big and bulky, looks like a child's plastic toy, smells bad and doesn't work well. I highly recommend NOT buying one of these craptastic pieces of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Leitch

customer_reviews.title: It would have been nice to be able to choose cross-country skiing as an ...
customer_reviews.text: I have turned off the heart rate monitor because it did not come close to my real heart rate I was exercising. It showed heart rates that a person my age could not possibly have. But that may have been because of some peculiarities in my heart rate pattern. It would have been nice to be able to choose cross-country skiing as an exercise it tracked, but setting it as bicycling did a fair job of tracking the skiing. Turning off heart rate tracking and automatic syncing lengthened the time before recharging was needed.
customer_reviews.author: rblaw

customer_reviews.title: Pretty big discrepancy between this and the chest strap/app combo
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the biking functionality. I find it unreliable as a heart rate monitor as compared to the chest strap. It loses connection when I sweat and misses some of my work out. Pretty big discrepancy between this and the chest strap/app combo. Fit bit makes some recommendations to keep that from happening but I didn't have good results. I would have saved some money and went with the charge HR. It is accurate enough for lighter activities. Wish they had replacement band options but they don't ....it's a little big too
customer_reviews.author: RC/ CK

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it was poorly glued with household or super glue
customer_reviews.text: This watch is less than 9 months old, and the band just came apart from the watch. It looks like it was poorly glued with household or super glue. I will be trying to contact the company and get a replacement. Horrible considering this is a $200 watch. I NEVER wear it in water or shower. I only put it on in the morning as I go out the door. If I do not get a replacement, I will definitely never purchase another item from FitBit. I have a 15 year old Garmin Forerunner that is STILL working and has never fallen apart!
customer_reviews.author: SGavenus

customer_reviews.title: Great, but it's still missing something
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that I'm satisfied by how much I paid for this. I'm unsure how every day that I wake up and I've made 150+ steps while sleeping. Spinning mode underestimates calorie count. Notifications could be improved. Plus many other flaws it has. And also, it does not last up to 7 days as it claims, It's more like 3 or 4 days maximum without charging. Great product, mispriced.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sayegh

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and in tact. It is perhaps one of the best fitness trackers I have owned yet. I bought this instead of the Apple Watch, because it does everything I wanted the apple watch to do and not only is it cheaper, it is a better fitness tracker, in that I am not tethered to the phone. Not having to carry my phone with me as I work out is important to me. That phone is a lot of weight and a little too pricy to risk on the court, in the gym or on the road running or cycling.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Newsome

customer_reviews.title: PITA Right Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable. Device comes without a user manual. They have a slip in the box telling you to log onto their site. Go there and there is no help. Spent an hour watching youtube videos trying to figure it out. Eventually I found a manual (PDF) on the internet which would have been nice to have been included with the device. Is $250 really not enough to merit a hard copy of the manual? So far, I am several hours into ownership and I hate it. I might change my mind later but the device is not intuitive and so far has been nothing but frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: XB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Fitbit Surge
customer_reviews.text: A little over two years ago (April 26, 2016), I purchased a Fitbit Surge for $199 via Amazon. Over the past two years, I have become very disappointed with this watch: the functions would disappear from the screen causing me to reboot the watch each time; the heart function would show zero (??); and, It would always display only HALF the number of calories burned as compared to every single cardio machine in the entire gym. The final straw - literally - was when I was running on the beach last week and the wrist strap just POPPED OFF!@*#!! (see photo) I gave Fitbit a chance...now it's time to buy an Apple Watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Band Flaw
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty good at the fitness tracking however there is a design flaw. The band cannot be replaced. I have had mine for 10 months and the rubber is delaminating from the plastic band and I am told the band cannot be replaced. You have to replace the Surge. Bad design, I would think different bands would be desirable options from both a manufacturing up sale opportunity and a customer driven option. I do wear mine every day but will now be looking for different options. BTW This one does require charging about every 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: dtitan

product_meta.title: Fitbit Surge, Tangerine, Small (US Version)
product_meta.description:
Color:Tangerine| Size:Small (5.5-6.3 in)Train smarter and go farther with Surge—a sleek, fitness super watch designed to help you maximize your performance on the track, in the gym and all day. Make the most of training with built-in GPS, automatic and continuous wrist-based heart rate, and simplified heart rate zones. Track daily stats like steps, distance, calories burned and sleep. Record runs, cross training and cardio to see comprehensive workout summaries. And stay connected on the move with advanced smartwatch features like call and text notifications and music control. With all these features and more, Surge has everything you need to beat your best.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Customers contact: support@fitbit.com
feature_bullets: Surge syncs automatically and wirelessly to tablets, computers and 150+ leading iOS, Android and Windows smartphones using Bluetooth 4.0 wireless technology.
Get continuous, automatic, wrist-based heart rate and simplified heart rate zones
Track workouts & view workout summaries; plus all day activities including steps, distance, calories burned, floors climbed and active minutes
Monitor your sleep automatically and wake with a silent alarm
Continuous, wrist-based heart rate monitoring for workout intensity, training zones, and calorie burn with no uncomfortable chest straps
24/7 heart rate readings to optimize health with resting heart rate and all day trends
Accurately track all-day activity like heart rate, steps, distance, calories burned, floors climbed and active minutes
Stay connected with text and call notifications on display
Sync stats wirelessly and automatically to your computer and over 100 leading smartphones
